params.name: x264PixelFormat
params.label: Color Format
params.description: Color depth and chroma subsampling format.

params.name: x264Preset
params.label: Preset
params.description: Predefined parameter presets.

params.name: x264Profile
params.label: Profile
params.description: Constraints the bitrate range and controls other properties such as compression algorithm and chroma format.

params.name: x264Tune
params.label: Tuning
params.description: Customize to fit your project encoding style.

params.name: x264Level
params.label: Level
params.description: Sets the level flag in the output bitstream (as defined by Annex A of the H.264 standard). This automatic detection is not perfect, and may underestimate the level if you are not using VBV controls to limit the max bitrate. If playback is intended on any consumer level product besides a HTPC, Level 4.1 is the maximum usually supported (Xbox 360, Playstation 3, Popcorn Hour A-100 Media Extender to name a few). The GPU-based DXVA decoders on PCs have a maximum level of 4.1 too. Blu-ray and HD DVD are Level 4.1. Note that x264 treats this setting as an output flag only. It does not take any measures to ensure compliance with the level you specify.

params.name: x264Strategy
params.label: Strategy
params.description: The encoding mode to use. Choose Average Bitrate (ABR), Constant Rate Factor (CRF) Constant Quantizer (CQP) or even Lossless.

subvalues.name: x264StrategyARB
subvalues.label: Average Bitrate [kbit]
subvalues.description: The average data rate allowed by the encoder.

subvalues.name: x264StrategyCRF
subvalues.label: Constant Rate Factor
subvalues.description: Lower values mean better quality but increase the processing time.

subvalues.name: x264StrategyQP
subvalues.label: Constant Quantizer
subvalues.description: Quality level of the video. Lower values mean better quality but increase file size and processing time.

params.name: x264KeyInt
params.label: Max. GOP Size
params.description: Maximum Group of Pictures Structure size in which intra- and inter-frames are arranged. Smaller values increase the video quality.

params.name: x264MinKeyInt
params.label: Min. GOP Size
params.description: Minimum Group of Pictures Structure size in which intra- and inter-frames are arranged. Smaller values increase the video quality.

params.name: x264Scenecut
params.label: Scenecut
params.description: Sets the threshold for IDR frame placement (read: scene change detection). x264 calculates a metric for every frame to estimate how different it is from the previous frame. If the value is lower than scenecut, an IDR frame is used. The metric is slightly more complex then, but it's a reasonable approximation. Higher values of scenecut increase the number of scenecuts detected.

params.name: x264BFrames
params.label: Number of B-Frames
params.description: Bipredective coded pictures contain motion-compensated difference information relative to previously decoded pictures. 0 is the best precision.

params.name: x264BAdapt
params.label: Adaptive B-Frames
params.description: The encoder determines the number of B-frames to use (within the B-frames limit).

params.name: x264BFrameBias
params.label: B-Frames Bias
params.description: The encoder chooses more likely higher numbers of B-frames during the adaptive lookahead.

params.name: x264BPyramid
params.label: B-Pyramid
params.description: Allows B-frames to be used as reference frames instead of only I or P-frames.

params.name: x264Ref
params.label: Ref
params.description: Controls the size of the DPB (Decoded Picture Buffer). In short, this value is the number of previous frames each P-frame can use as references. B-frames can use one or two fewer, depending on if they are used as references or not.

params.name: x264Slices
params.label: Slices per Frame
params.description: The encoder divides each frame into X regions and searches for redundancies in other frames only within the respective region.

params.name: x264SlicesMax
params.label: Max. Slices per Frame
params.description: Maximum amount of slices for one frame.

params.name: x264SliceMax
params.label: Max. Size of Slice
params.description: Maximum size of a slice for one frame.

params.name: x264Deblock
params.label: Deblocking
params.description: Controls the loop filter (aka inloop deblocker) which is part of the h264 standard. The loop filter takes a rather large slice of decoding time for a single item, and is responsible for a similar slice of the overall quality output. It is very efficient in terms of encoding time vs. quality gained.

params.name: x264NoDeblock
params.label: Disable deblocking
params.description: Completely disables in-loop deblocking.

params.name: x264OpenGop
params.label: Open GOP
params.description: Open GOPs have to look at both previous and upcoming frames to create a full image. Those reduce the overall file size.

params.name: x264NoCabac
params.label: Disable CABAC
params.description: Context Adaptive Binary Arithmetic Coding is a compression method in the lossless phase of the encoding process that can significantly reduce the required bit rate, especially at high data rates.

params.name: x264VBVMaxBitrate
params.label: VBV Max. Bitrate [kbit]
params.description: VBV underflow signals an encoder rate buffer overflow. VBV overflow signals an encoder rate buffer underflow.

params.name: x264VBVBufferSize
params.label: VBV Buffer Size [kbit]
params.description: The Video Buffering Verifier bitstream buffer size.

params.name: x264VBVInitBuffer
params.label: VBV Initial Buffer
params.description: The Video Buffering Verifier validates that the encoded stream doesn't overflow or underflow the decoder's buffer.

params.name: x264QPMin
params.label: Min. Quantizer
params.description: The minimum frame quantizer.

params.name: x264QPMax
params.label: Max. Quantizer
params.description: The maximum frame quantizer.

params.name: x264QPStep
params.label: Quantizer Delta
params.description: Determines for the encoding methods 2-pass and 1-pass bitrate how much the quantizer may fluctuate from one frame to the next.

params.name: x264Ratetol
params.label: Rate tolerance
params.description: Only applicable to 1pass bitrate encodes. Sets the percentage that x264 can miss the target average bitrate by. 1.0 = 1%. This means the final average bitrate (and corresponding filesize) will be within about +/- 1% of what you set.

params.name: x264IPRatio
params.label: I:P Ratio
params.description: Determines by which factor a P-frame is to be quantized more than the I-frame that uses it as a reference.

params.name: x264PBRatio
params.label: P:B Ratio
params.description: Determines by which factor a B-frame is to be quantized more than the P-frame that uses it as a reference.

params.name: x264ChromaQPOffset
params.label: Chroma QP Offset
params.description: This quantizes the color information (chroma) of the image differently from the brightness information (luma).

params.name: x264AQStrength
params.label: Adaptive Quantizer Strength
params.description: Selects the adaptive quantization algorithm that quantizes less detailed image areas more. The saved bits can then be used in other parts of the image for better detail.

params.name: x264QuantizerCompression
params.label: Quantizer Compression
params.description: Quantizer curve compression factor. 0.0 => Constant Bitrate, 1.0 => Constant Quantizer. Note that adaptive quantization partially replaces the effect of qcomp and x264 will internally raise qcomp to compensate based on the adaptive quantization strength.

params.name: x264Cplxblur
params.label: CPLX blur
params.description: Apply a gaussian blur with the given radius to the quantizer curve. This means that the quantizer assigned to each frame is blurred temporally with its neighbours to limit quantizer fluctuations.

params.name: x264Qblur
params.label: Q blur
params.description: Apply a gaussian blur with the given radius to the quantizer curve, after curve compression. Not a very important setting.

params.name: x264Zones
params.label: Zones
params.description: With this option you can specify different CRF rates for different parts of the video. For examle you specify CRF=20 for the full length of the video but you want to use CRF=18.5 from FRAME 27000 to 35000 and CRF=16.5 from 44000 to 49000 and CRF=17.5 from 75000 to 77500 and so on. This option is based on frame numbers.

params.name: x264RCLookahead
params.label: Frame lookahead
params.description: Determines how many frames the mb-tree and VBV algorithms are allowed to look into the future. The higher the value, the more memory and computing time is required.

params.name: x264NoMBTree
params.label: Disable MB-Tree
params.description: Disables the default active macroblock tree ratecontrol. Only interesting for very fast encodings at the expense of quality.

params.name: x264Partitions
params.label: Partitions
params.description: h264 video is split up into 16x16 macroblocks during compression. These blocks can be further split up into smaller partitions, which is what this options controls. With this option, you enable individual partitions. Partitions are enabled per-frametype (ie I, P, B). The available partitions are: p8x8, p4x4, b8x8, i8x8, i4x4

params.name: x264Direct
params.label: Direct MV prediction mode
params.description: Specifies whether temporal or spatial information is used in B-frames to compress direct blocks (i.e. blocks without their own movement vector).

params.name: x264Direct8x8
params.label: Direct prediction size
params.description: Set the size of the direct prediction mode. Enabling direct-8x8 inference (on by default at most levels) may slightly improve quality when used with 8x8dct.

params.name: x264MERange
params.label: ME Range
params.description: Defines the size of the area in which motion is searched for.

params.name: x264MVRange
params.label: MV Range
params.description: Defines the max. length of the motion vector.

params.name: x264SubME
params.label: Sub-Pixel Refinement
params.description: Defines the quality level for the subpixel motion search and the partition decision.

values.name: SAD mode decision, one qpel iteration
RD mode decision for all frames
Full RD: disable all early terminations

params.name: x264PsyRD
params.label: Psy RD
params.description: First number is the strength of Psy-RDO to use (requires subme>=6 to activate). The second number is the strength of Psy-Trellis (requires trellis>=1 to activate). Note that Trellis is still considered 'experimental', and almost certainly is a Bad Thing for at least cartoons.

params.name: x264NoChromaME
params.label: Disable Chroma Motion Estimation
params.description: By deactivating, the encoder uses only the luminance for motion search in the brightness information (luma).

params.name: x264NoMixedRefs
params.label: Disable Mixed Reference Frames
params.description: Prohibits the encoder from selecting reference images not only for each macro block, but for each block partition individually.

params.name: x264Trellis
params.label: Trellis
params.description: Trellis weighs between detail preservation and lower data rate by rounding up or down coefficients according to certain criteria.

params.name: x264No
params.label: Disable DCT Decimation
params.description: Prevents very small coefficients from being rounded to zero in DCT.

params.name: x264NoFastPSkip
params.label: Disable Fast P-Skip
params.description: Disables accelerated processing of P-frames.

params.name: x264NoPsy
params.label: Disable Psychovisual Enhancements
params.description: Turn off all psychovisual optimizations. This concerns PsyRD, PsyTrellis and AQ as well as some internal Psy optimizations.

params.name: x264NalHrd
params.label: NAL HRD Mode
params.description: Signal HRD information. Required for Blu-Ray streams or broadcasts.

params.name: x264BlurayCompat
params.label: Blu-Ray Compatibility
params.description: Create video files that will be compatible for Blu-Ray discs.

params.name: x264AUD
params.label: Use AUD
params.description: Access unit delimiter can be used for signaling about start of video frame.

params.name: x264FakeInterlaced
params.label: Fake Interlaced
params.description: Flag stream as interlaced but encode progressive. Makes it possible to encode 25p and 30p Blu-Ray.
